revised_title: Graphite/Aluminium Halides: Synthesis and Properties of Synthetic Metals
tldr: The authors studied the synthesis and properties of synthetic metals based on graphite and aluminium halides. They found that aluminium halides intercalate into graphite, forming compounds with increased electrical conductivity. The authors also investigated the role of additional halogen in the intercalation process and discussed the implications of these findings for solid state chemistry and the behavior of synthetic metals.
